intro: Dalea brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandeggea milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its unique, pink to purple pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Dalea brandegeei plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators in its native habitat.
